adjective.definition: Expressing adverse or disapproving comments or judgments.
adjective.example: He was very critical of the previous leadership.

adjective.definition: Having a decisive or crucial importance in the success, failure, or existence of something.

noun.definition: The expression of disapproval of someone or something based on perceived faults or mistakes.
noun.example: He received a lot of criticism for his decision.

noun.definition: A person who expresses an unfavorable opinion of something.

verb.definition: Indicate the faults of (someone or something) in a disapproving way.
verb.example: The report criticized the government's handling of the crisis.

usage_examples: The patient is in a critical condition.
It is critical to follow the instructions.
